title: Virtual Reality-Enhanced Instructional Design for Students with Disabilities: Building Flexible Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Knowledge in Speech-Language Pathology and Special Education, with Over 3 Years of Field Experience in Special Education
context.additional_context: Smartphone-based low-fidelity VR technology utilization, focusing on developing field-applicable customized solutions

learning_goals: Design an assessment framework to analyze language learning needs of students with disabilities in virtual reality environments
Develop three or more adaptive instructional materials using smartphone-compatible VR tools
Implement VR learning scenarios based on flexible instructional design principles and apply effectiveness verification procedures

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
